result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:31 AM Defendant Ross A. Hoffman in court, in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Ross A. Hoffman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Larimore - matter is not resolved.
State - speaks of Miranda child issues. Will be playing interviews at trial and filing motion for AVRS to be played at trial. Asks for hearing motion hearing to address that. 
Court - sets motion hearing. Filings due on or before 12/23/22
Motion hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Motion hearing on January 13, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Scheduling Order

9:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ross A. Hoffman in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Ross A. Hoffman. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Larimore - not resolved. Set for trial
Court - sets 2 day JT. Filings due on or before Feb 20th.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on March 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on March 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Protective Order - granted
Protective Order
Stipulation for Protective Order

10:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ross A. Hoffman appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared by video for Ross A. Hoffman. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Larimore - understands charges and penalties. Rcvd Information. Enters NG plea for all counts. Asking for status conf.
State - would rather have a date in May. Asks court to go over wavier of personal appearance.
Atty Larimore - did not discuss waiver of personal appearance with client.
Court - speaks of waiver of personal appearance. Can be brought up now if he wants to appear.
DE - does not want to be brought up or reschedule this hearing.
Court - finds defendant knowingly waives personal appearance and presence of attorney with him.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request to Appear Remotely at Arraignment on 4/1/22 at 10:45 AM
from Judge Wagner to Attorney Larimore RE: current status of case

ADDRESS INFO for Ross A. Hoffman
Current: 615 Stokke Parkway, c/o Dunn County Jail, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States  (Effective: 01-03-2022)
Prior: E2004 950th Avenue, Boyceville, WI 54725
Arraignment on April 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Request to Schedule with Appointed Attorney
Attorney Joel Larimore
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Amended from $75,000 cash to $150,000 cash. No contact with anyone under the age of 18.

9:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ross A. Hoffman appeared in court in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk
Court - matter is set for bond hearing and Arraignment.
Atty Tomtschik - this case still needs counsel appointed. Appearing as friend of court today. Asks for another preliminary hearing due to waiver and new counts now being added.
Court - would like to set status or another prelim.
State - speaks of prelim request.
Court - will set new Arraignment date so counsel can be assigned. Speaks of bond modification request.
State - argues for bond to be increased from $75,000 cash to $200,000 cash bond. No contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Atty Tomtschik - argues
Court - orders bond be increased to $150,000 cash. No contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Arraignment scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Arraignment on April 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Arraignment on February 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:45 AM Defendant, Ross A. Hoffman, in custody, appeared with Attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  A. Standaert - Clerk
Deft - waives preliminary hearing
Court - accepts waiver and finds probable cause, binds deft over for trial  Arraignment scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.
